Note: User/ PT feedback . They didn’t like the fact that they couldn’t see the photos they were taking before it was sent . That is in comparison to the MR glasses.
The user / PT was also concerned about the offset in terms of the camera position and how pictures captured are actually displayed .

User/PT feedback while the Gen2 are more comfortable, they would not use it all day because they don’t seem as functional. In their words , it’s just like having a headset. They also mentioned that they would prefer to be able to see a text and as such would prefer to use their phone in comparison to the gen2 glasses . They do prefer the MR glasses but then because of the weight , they wouldn’t like to wear that all day.

In terms of camera functionality, the photos taken by the Gen2 glasses are exactly as they would like their photos to be , more like the visual cone . But the photos / videos from the MR glasses were too broad and undesirable - appeared like a 180 degree shot.
User / PT also mentioned that taking photos / videos with the gen2 glasses felt “ natural”  in comparison to the other glasses which felt very awkward in terms of positioning and the view.
The user/PT experienced a repetitive response generation at some point during the scavenger hunt with meta AI.
In terms of using the maps app, the user didn’t find it useful because directions were always being sent to the phone .
Towards the end of the session. The meta app kept indicating that there was no service even though it was connected on the phone.
